definition: lit. use others' strengths to make up for one's weak points (idiom from Mencius)/to use this in place of that/what you lose on the swings, you win on the roundabouts
to take/to get/to choose/to fetch
chief/head/elder/to grow/to develop/to increase/to enhance
length/long/forever/always/constantly
to repair/to patch/to mend/to make up for/to fill (a vacancy)/to supplement
short/brief/to lack/weak point/fault

sentences.english: A:Therefore,I hope they could help each other and learn from each other.
sentences.chinese: 所以我希望他倆能命相幫助，取長補短。

sentences.english: Exchanges with tourists, they found that their lack of each other.
sentences.chinese: 跟遊客交流，發現自己的不足，取長補短。

sentences.english: Secondly, it is to help make up each other's deficiencies and improve subsistence capability.
sentences.chinese: 二是有利於取長補短，提高生存技能。

sentences.english: He expressed hope that Chinese and American filmmakers will be able to learn from each other.
sentences.chinese: 他希望中美電影製作人能夠相互取長補短。

sentences.english: Is not blind obedience is each other, and accepting good advice.
sentences.chinese: 不盲從是取長補短，擇善而從。

definition: to yield to one another/mutual accommodation
to master the subject via a comprehensive study of surrounding areas
to seek common ground, putting differences aside (idiom)
